info.title: Once Media Management API Reference
info.description: The Media Management API is a RESTful API for accessing and configuring the components of the domain for an authorized user. The multi-faceted and cascading configuration hierarchy gives the domain owner the ability to set-up domain, application, catalog and mediaitem level settings. The authorized user has the ability to create, read, update and delete anything from ad configurations to metadata on independent media items. It provides easy to use methods for fronting UI components in an existing CMS or through a programmatic function.

post.description: Create an adServer, defining the base URL and query string variables that will be fired to your ad provider for a single VAST ad or DFP/SmartXML ad playlist response. Please see our guide for Converting an ad tag for the Once Media Management API.

get.description: Retrieves all ad decisioning servers configured in the domain. This method returns 20 results by default, totalResults indicates the total number of applications in the domain, previous and/or next page request URLs will be included within the response if necessary. URL Parameters may be appended to modify result sets.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items to return for the request

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The set of items (based on pageSize) to return

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

delete.description: Deletes the specified ad decisioning server. NOTE: This change will remove any application adConfigs utilizing the deleted adServer.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specified adServer.

post.description: Update the specified adServer’s name, base URL, and/or variables. NOTE: This change will affect any application adConfigs utilizing the updated adServer. If you need an updated adServer configuration without changing existing applications or ad configurations, create a new adServer and then create or modify applications and their adConfigs to use the new adServer.

post.summary: Add or Replace Application Ad Configuration
post.description: Add or replace the adConfig assigned to the specified application. Below are two examples:  Single VAST ad request(s) will be made for each configured adPosition (preRoll, midRoll, and/or postRoll). Multiple (ad) configuration, enabling an ad decisioning server to specify all ad breaks in a single response (Freewheel SmartXML, DFP Ad Rules).

delete.description: Deletes all ad configurations from the specified application.

get.description: Retrieves all adConfigs assigned to a single Application. Below are two examples: 1.Single VAST ad request(s) will be made for each configured adPosition (preRoll, midRoll, and/or postRoll). 2.Multiple (ad) configuration, enabling an ad decisioning server to specify all ad breaks in a single response (Freewheel SmartXML, DFP Ad Rules).

post.description: Creates an new application in the domain.

get.description: Returns all applications configured in the domain. This method returns 20 results by default, totalResults indicates the total number of applications in the domain, previous and/or next page request URLs will be included within the response if necessary. URL Parameters may be appended to modify result sets.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items to return for the request

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The set of items (based on pageSize) to return

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

delete.description: Deletes an application from the domain. This method will delete all of the application’s adConfigs, but will not delete any related adServer(s). See below for a method to delete adServers.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an application, including its ad configurations. Below are two examples:  Single VAST ad request(s) will be made for each configured adPosition (preRoll, midRoll, and/or postRoll). Multiple (ad) configuration, enabling an ad decisioning server to specify all ad breaks in a single response (Freewheel SmartXML, DFP Ad Rules).

post.description: Update the name or number of ads requested in the VAST pre/mid/postRoll slots.

Add the specified new rendition to a catalog’s rendition set. New mediaItems ingested to the catalog will be assigned the specified rendition. NOTE: This method will not add the specified rendition to existing mediaItems in the catalog. Please contact Support if you also need new renditions assigned to previously-ingested mediaItems.

Creates a new catalog within the parent domainId. You may specify renditions when creating the catalog, otherwise it will be assigned all domain renditions marked as default. The new catalog will also inherit any domain publication rules.

get.description: Retrieves all catalogs in a domain. This method returns 20 results by default, totalResults indicates the total number of catalogs, previous and/or next page request URLs will be included within the response if necessary. URL Parameters may be appended to modify result sets.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items to return for the request

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The set of items (based on pageSize) to return

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

put.description: Assign a new name to the specified catalogId.

post.description: Create a catalog publication rule. NOTE: A new catalog publication rule created by this method will only be applied to new mediaItems ingested to the catalog, but will not be applied to existing mediaItems within. Please see below for a method to create or update publication rules assigned to individual mediaItems.

delete.description: Delete the specified rendition from a catalog’s rendition set. New mediaItems ingested to the catalog will no longer be assigned the specified rendition. NOTE: This method will not remove the specified rendition from existing mediaItems in the catalog. Please contact Support if you also need the specified rendition removed from previously-ingested mediaItems.

parameters.name: renditionId
parameters.description: The rendition id to remove from the catalog set

get.description: Returns the settings of the selected transcode rendition indicated by the renditionId.

put.description: Replace (overwrite) the specified catalog’s current rendition set, using an updated array in the request body. NOTE: This method will not add the specified rendition(s) to, nor will it remove renditions from, existing mediaitems in the specified catalog. Please contact Support if you also need renditions assigned to or removed from previously-ingested mediaItems in the catalog.

get.description: Retrieves all publicationRuleIds assigned to a Catalog. Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.
Retrieves the rendition set assigned to the specified catalog. NOTE: All videos ingested to this catalog will have these renditions assigned.
Retrieves details of a specified catalog
Retrieves configuration of a catalog-level publication rule.

delete.description: Deletes the specified catalog publication rule. NOTE: Deleting a catalog publication rule will prevent it from being applied to new mediaItems ingested to the catalog, but will not delete publication rules of existing mediaItems within. Please see below for the method to delete publication rules assigned to mediaItems.

put.description: Update a catalog publication rule. NOTE: Updates made by this method will only be applied to new mediaItems ingested to the catalog, but will not update publication rules of existing mediaItems within. Please see below for a method to update publication rules assigned to individual mediaItems.

post.description: Retrieves all publicationRuleIds configured on the Domain level. Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

get.description: Retrieves all publicationRuleIds configured on the Domain level. Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

delete.description: Deletes the specified domain publication rule. NOTE: Deleting a domain publication rule will prevent it from being added to new catalogs, but will not delete publication rules of existing catalogs or mediaItems within. Please see below for methods to delete publication rules assigned to catalogs or mediaItems.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

get.description: Retrieves all publicationRuleIds configured on the Domain level. Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

put.description: Retrieves all publicationRuleIds configured on the Domain level. Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

delete.description: Deletes a timed text asset for captions and subtitles for a specified media item.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

parameters.name: timedTextId
parameters.description: The id for the timed text asset

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The id for the catalog that the media item belongs to

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: The id for the media item

get.description: Retrieves details of a timed text asset for captions and subtitles.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

parameters.name: timedTextId
parameters.description: The id for the timed text asset

get.description: Retrieves all Transcoding Renditions available in your domain (note, new videos will be assigned renditions based on the configured Catalog Renditions).

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

get.description: Retrieves all timed text for captions and subtitles for the domain.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

get.description: Retrieves domain name and domainId.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

get.description: Retrieves video and audio encoding settings for the specified renditionId.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

post.summary: Create Media Item Timed Text Asset
post.description: Creates a timed text asset for captions and subtitles for a specified media item.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The id for the catalog that the media item belongs to

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: The id for the media item

get.summary: Get Media Item Timed Text Asset
get.description: Retrieves the timed text asset for captions and subtitles for a specified media item.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The id for the catalog that the media item belongs to

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: The id for the media item

delete.description: Returns the essential information of the media item.

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: The mediaItem Id (you can substitute foreignKey for mediaItemId)

get.description: Retrieves details of a specified mediaItem.

post.description: Updates the mediaItem to reflect the request body. NOTE: All mediaItem fields must be present in your request, not just those you wish to update. Existing fields with missing values in the update request will be overwritten with null values.

delete.description: Deletes the specified mediaItem publication rule.

get.description: Retrieves configuration of a mediaItem-level publication rule.

Retrieves all publicationRuleIds assigned to a mediaItem.  Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.

Returns a collection of all media items within a catalog. This method fetches 20 media items per page, returns the totalResult to indicate the total number of media items and provides the previous or next page requests within the body.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items to return for the request

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The set of items (based on pageSize) to return

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter to media items that have title substring. E.g. title=foo could return media items with title "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

parameters.name: foreignKey
parameters.description: Filter to media items that have foreign key substring. E.g. foreignKey=foo could return media items with foreign key "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"

post.summary: Update Media Item Timed Text Asset
post.description: Updates a timed text asset for captions and subtitles for a specified media item.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The id for the catalog that the media item belongs to

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: The id for the media item

parameters.name: timedTextId
parameters.description: The id for the timed text asset

variables.description: An object set of query string key/value pairs to be inserted/appended to the base URL at request time. Response variable order may not match your original input, this is expected and will not affect ad tag performance.

Bad.description: Request - json - 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body

Forbidden.description: 403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key

Not.description: Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

languages.description: An array of ISO 639-1 two-letter language codes for the captions or subtitles - for example: ["en", "fr"]

format.description: The format of the captions or subtitles, such as SRT

version.description: The version of the captions or subtitles

default.description: If true, will be assigned to new catalogs by default

timedTextType.description: The type  of the timed text: CAPTION or SUBTITLE

draftVersion.description: The iteration of that specific mediaItem (will increment if a new version of the video is ingested)

publishedVersion.description: The iteration of that specific mediaItem (will increment if a new version of the video is ingested)

prev.description: URL to GET the previous adServer result set (if necessary)

next.description: URL to GET the next adServer result set (if necessary)

totalResults.description: The total number of adServer in the domain

Bad.description: Request - json - 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body

Forbidden.description: 403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key

Not.description: Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path
